form.official-title: To amend the Safe Drinking Water Act to modify eligibility for the State response to contaminants program, and for other purposes.

section.header: Technical fix for State response to contaminants program
section.text: Section 1459A(j) of the Safe Drinking Water Act (42 U.S.C. 300j–19a(j)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking subsection (c)(2) and inserting clause (i) or (ii) of subparagraph (A) of paragraph (3) or a drinking water well owner described in subparagraph (B) of that paragraph;
by striking contaminant— and all that follows through to— in subparagraph (A) in the matter preceding clause (i) and inserting contaminant that is determined by the State—;
by redesignating clauses (i) and (ii) as subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively, and indenting appropriately;

clause.text: by inserting to before be present;
by striking serving, and inserting serving a community; and
by striking for, that community; and
by inserting to before potentially; and
by striking ; and at the end and inserting a period; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Eligibility for assistance or as a beneficiary of assistance
paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the Administrator may issue a grant to a State—

subparagraph.text: that is requesting a grant on behalf of—

clause.text: a community that, under the affordability criteria established by the State under section 1452(d)(3), is determined by the State to be—

subclause.text: a community that may become a disadvantaged community as a result of carrying out an activity described in paragraph (1); or

clause.text: a community with a population of fewer than 10,000 individuals that the Administrator determines does not have the capacity to incur debt sufficient to finance an activity described in paragraph (1); or

subparagraph.text: for the benefit of 1 or more owners of drinking water wells that are not public water systems and are not connected to a public water system.
